column4: question about static IPs.  I'm setting my IP via /etc/network/interfaces (http://pastebin.com/d36f20721) but when usb0 comes up I don't have an IPv4 assigned.  The same setup works properly on my desktop, but this is on my laptop and is causing me grief.  Any ideas?
have you got an 'auto usb0' line in interfaces?
so you plug the usb device in, but it fails to get the static IP?
nothing helpful in /var/log/syslog relating to the plug-in event?
usb0 comes up, but no inet or gateway.  It seems to get a inet6 addr though.  odd
the only things left out are the two lo lines
this is the same setup I have on my desktop, which is why I'm confused as to the problem
there must be a tiny inconspicuous difference...
perhaps udev rules capture the device and take precedence over what's in interfaces. I don't understand udev well, but I'd have a look there
maybe, but both systems are 8.04, so udev should be the same
/etc/network/interfaces was correct, other then I had a tab character instead of spaces for one of the lines
wow, that's worth a bug report. It should treat any whitespace the same
